image.altText: Two people wearing dark blue scrubs walk away from the camera through a modern-looking hospital building.

props.synopsis: They were treated as "heroes and angels" during the pandemic years, but the number of occupational violence incidents against healthcare workers and staff working in Canberra's Health Services is steadily increasing, new documents reveal.

title.children: Steady rise in occupational violence incidents at Canberra's hospitals

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and glasses smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The university paid the former vice-chancellor a severance package of more than $400,000 in income and superannuation.

title.children: Former ANU boss Genevieve Bell receives $400,000 exit pay

image.altText: A brown silo with the words Tarago written on it, with a street in its background

props.synopsis: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

title.children: Sydney's rubbish leaves farmers feeling like 'second-class citizens'

image.altText: Radford College

props.synopsis: Financial errors are being blamed for one school being hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt and hiking school fees by 23 per cent.

title.children: 'We will not allow our kids to be thrown under the bus because of bad governance'

image.altText: Hands hold a phone with the screen turned up.

props.synopsis: Luke was only minutes into his first shift at his new workplace when he began hearing his colleagues making homophobic comments. Despite being a resident of Australia's most progressive city, he says he no longer feels safe in public.

title.children: Experiences of homophobia 'happening every day' in Australia's most progressive city

image.altText: Laura sits outside and looks seriously into the camera.

props.synopsis: A new report by victim-led advocacy organisation With You We Can makes the case for all victim-survivors of sexual violence to have access to independent legal representation.

title.children: Laura felt unsupported in the justice system. She wants that to change

image.altText: Michelle Heyman of Canberra United is preparing to kick the football during a match

props.synopsis: Michelle Heyman is 'uncomfortable' with the A-League Women continuing without international players as the Matildas prepare for their last matches before the AFC Women's Asian Cup.

title.children: Heyman 'uncomfortable' with missing ALW for Matildas

image.altText: Police tape in front of a street with a house and cars in background.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a 71-year-old man who allegedly shot at officers during an attempted arrest was later found dead on a property in Canberra's south.

title.children: Man who allegedly shot at police during DV-related arrest found dead

image.altText: A young Lebanese man bushwalking.

props.synopsis: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

title.children: 27 migrants went bushwalking hoping to shatter some myths

image.altText: a firefighter tackles flames in a forest fire

props.synopsis: Eastern Australia is facing a barrage of extreme weather conditions this week, and for many areas the most intense conditions will arrive today.

title.children: Eastern states to get extreme heat, winds and catastrophic fire danger

image.altText: A photo of a woman leaning on a car with the windshield smashed

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms have rolled across south-east Queensland this week, causing widespread power outages, school closures, and restricting phone service.

title.children: Qld storms akin to Cyclone Alfred, with more wild weather on the way

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: More than 14,000 Optus services south of Melbourne were affected by the Wednesday morning outage, which the telco says was caused by vandals attempting to steal copper.

title.children: No Triple Zero calls disrupted by significant outage, Optus says

image.altText: indigenous man with cap sits in boat on river

props.synopsis: For months, people in remote Indigenous communities have been reporting skin rashes after going in the water, and a report confirms something is wrong with the river.

title.children: The river is life for these remote communities, but no-one will swim in it

image.altText: In front of a row of Ukrainian and US flags, Trump and Zelenskyy sit side by side, their hands clasped in their laps.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he has instructed his special envoy, Steve Witkoff, to meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss a "fine-tuned" peace plan for Ukraine.

title.children: Trump orders peace envoy to meet Putin in Moscow

image.altText: A smiling blond child of four years of age with curly hair

props.synopsis: A renewed police search for missing four-year-old Gus is expected to enter its second day, with no indication of any clues revealed so far.

title.children: Mine search for Gus expected to resume as locals tell of shock

image.altText: A couple smile and pose in front of a poster displaying a proposed housing build.

props.synopsis: Four years after buying a housing plot, the Websters' land is still vacant, without a water or sewer connection, and they have now been told to expect those services by 2028.

title.children: 'Mind boggling': Tens of thousands of new homes without essential services

image.altText: Jim Chalmers presser

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers has denied he asked federal departments to cut staff and slash budgets after the government requested savings be found. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers denies he directed public service to make cuts to find savings

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mortgage holders can 'kiss goodbye' hope of a rate cut: O'Brien
Annual inflation ticks up in October
Voter study shows Coalition loses status as better economic manager

image.altText: Ted O'Brien with Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien will address the National Press Club on Wednesday.

title.children: Coalition makes tax cut pitch in bid to restore credibility among young

image.altText: Jennifer is smiling, has arms wrapped around Paul, who is looking at her. They are at the beach.

props.synopsis: Court documents allege the hospital breached its duty of care while caring for Port Fairy woman Jennifer Buchanan.

title.children: Family sues Geelong Hospital over alleged medical negligence

image.altText: A map with an area of Melbourne highlighted.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's CBD will become a designated area from this weekend for six months, giving police the power to search people and vehicles for prohibited weapons without a warrant.

title.children: Police search powers in Melbourne CBD criticised as 'gross invasion'

image.altText: A woman sits smiling on top of a giant plush bunny lying on its back, surrounded by bright walls and pink flowery carpet

props.synopsis: Whether it's enormous puppets, interactive bunny installations or handmade ceramics, these artists are embracing joy, whimsy and silliness to help people connect to their inner child.

title.children: 'To be childlike is admirable': The artists embracing their inner child

image.altText: A white flower with big red spots on the petals is found nestled in the earth.

props.synopsis: A team of researchers describe the "magical" experience of finding a rare species of flower in bloom deep in the Sumatran rainforest after a 23-hour trek.

title.children: Researcher cries after finding rare flower in Indonesia

image.altText: An illustration of four hands grabbing into a paper written 'Work and Holiday Visa'.

props.synopsis: Thousands of young Indonesians want the chance to come to Australia to work, but first they have to win a visa application "war" that puts them in the sights of scammers and dodgy operators promising them what they want — for a price.

title.children: 'The names have been selected': Crooked operators rig working visas

image.altText: man and woman smiling

props.synopsis: Helena Popovic took her father on a trip home to Serbia after he was diagnosed with dementia and believes its reminiscence therapy slowed the condition's progress.

title.children: Australians with dementia urged to revisit the past like Hemsworth family

image.altText: Packets of illegal cigarettes displayed on a table.

props.synopsis: Convenience stores along the popular strip are scarcely stocked with chocolate bars and chewing gum but it's the merchandise under the counter that's really paying the rent.

title.children: How illegal tobacco traders continue to ply their trade on renowned cafe strip

image.altText: Two young boys on a detention centre roof.

props.synopsis: For most, the absence of youth detention from the headlines after years of chaos would have been an indication things were working well — but Monday's troubling disturbance shows just how much still needs to be done.

title.children: Minister urged to heed expert advice to avoid more Banksia Hill trouble

image.altText: A brown silo with the words Tarago written on it, with a street in its background

props.synopsis: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

title.children: Sydney's rubbish leaves farmers feeling like 'second-class citizens'

image.altText: A young toddler boy stands in muddy water flooding tents around him.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain causes significant flooding in Gaza, with thousands of Palestinians living in tents bearing the brunt of the sudden burst of winter weather.

title.children: Palestinians left without shelter after Gaza tent cities flood again

image.altText: The popemobile, with a truck shape and a glass room in the back is placed inside a large glass box outside

props.synopsis: A former "Popemobile" used by Pope Francis during his 2014 tour of the Holy Land has been transformed into a mobile health clinic for Gaza's children, but Israeli authorities are yet to give permission for it to enter the war-ravaged strip.

title.children: Pope Francis's Popemobile transformed into mobile clinic for Gaza children

image.altText: A young, dark-haired boy in a bushy area.

props.synopsis: The grieving parents of a four-year-old boy who drowned in a suburban lagoon are suing Melbourne Water and a council over the tragedy.

title.children: Parents of drowned boy sue over 'inadequate' fence

image.altText: A close up of a rat's face.

props.synopsis: A rat infestation has forced the temporary closure of Peacock House, one of Tasmania's few public inpatient mental health facilities.

title.children: Mental health beds closed in Hobart due to rat infestation

image.altText: A house on fire.

props.synopsis: Police believe arsonists targeted a home in Melbourne's inner west overnight, forcing a family to flee the property.

title.children: Police believe Melbourne house fire was targeted attack

image.altText: a sign saying "Waranyjarri Estate" with red empty dirt in the background

props.synopsis: A number of people slept in front of a real estate office in Western Australia's far north on Monday night in an attempt to purchase a block of land.

title.children: Unusual scenes as people camp out to buy land in regional WA

image.altText: People marching while holding posters and banners about ending violence against women.

props.synopsis: Men and boys are being urged to play a part in changing the culture of violence against women and children, as the annual 16 Days in WA campaign began with a rally in the Perth CBD.

title.children: Call for men to step up and help end family and domestic violence

image.altText: Large piles of coal are stacked on the ground with loading machinery above them.

props.synopsis: A newly formed Queensland company has taken over a majority shareholding in a Bowen Basin coal mine, securing 1,000 jobs.

title.children: Premier says newly formed Queensland company secures 1,000 coal mining jobs
